result.execSummary:
Daniel A. Absalom was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Daniel A. Absalom was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel A. Absalom not in court.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Extradited.

Defendant Daniel A. Absalom in court in custody with attorney Jason Mitchel Daane.  Scott Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Extradition waived freely and voluntarily; Waiver signed in open court.  Further proceedings scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Daniel A. Absalom in court in custody with attorney Matthew Lantta.  Mark M. Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Extradition hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015, at 1:30 pm.
Defendant Daniel A. Absalom not in court.  Katharine Buker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
